review: 5/10 almost good but ok

The series could have been better if the writers could have invested more in character development. I mean, literally, Hulk spent years attempting to control himself from hurting others, because of the collateral damage he could inflict on society. She hulk control herself better because she is a woman? . That's kind of lame writing. Perhaps, they should justify it by adding a counterbalance. For instance, they could suggest that She hulk is not as strong as the hulk, and thus, she has better control of herself. Or, that she will experience a feral state, because , the transformation will become more violent; and she might continiously lose control over it cronically.
Guys, I know this show has not been doing well. But you cannot deny: that Michael "Morbing-chilling-Time" Morbius cameo was the most scene ever!
Really wonder how she gets her powers. Hope it makes sense cuz it would be weird if they make it seem like anyone can become a hulk easily through science.

I hope if we do see Charlie Cox’s Daredevil in this series , I hope it’s not just for a cameo here or there , he needs to be part of the story in any given way & rumors are saying he could appear in a few episodes as a guest star
I miss Bruce Banner. I'm expecting this series to explain why he is back in his human form in Shang Chi's end credits
I really want Banner or hulk to have much more screentime because they're my fav character. And I wish this show will be like Moonknight. Unexpected, with good comedic timing
First it was Sonic, now it's She Hulk. I am sure they'll fix that when they finish the whole filming process.

I’m going to watch. The CGI for her is the only thing I’m a little iffy on. But if the story is good, and there are implications for the wider MCU, it’ll make up for it. Less-than-perfect CGI doesn’t make or break a film/series.
Really hope they actually make her look, well, hulking when it comes out because all they showed here was how she went from a woman to a taller, green woman.
Although the story is about She-Hulk, I’m really hoping that they’ll show a brief flashback of Bruce’s journey before he became Professor Hulk, like him fighting one of Hulk’s villains.

From the first teaser images, I was kind of skeptical. But seeing her in action makes it look like classic she-hulk is in. The face looks good enough to just lay on the outskirts of uncanny valley. Also, abomination with his ear fins, so much better than the hulk film where he looked like, well i would say an abomination but that would be praise. I think they have found the right mix of lighting/skin shading textures to have it come across as real, without forcing too much detail.
I am looking forward to seeing what this is all about. Hopefully, the CGI is cleaned up before it is released.
Hard to tell if this will be my kind of show.
Trailer didn’t fully sell me yet.
The trailer looks okay overall. The concept is interesting, but it’s hard to tell how well the tone and humor will work from this alone. I’ll wait to see more before forming a strong opinion.
im glad that they are keeping in the humor of the comic and it's great that she is representing the abomination
